keyword: how many calories are in a taco bell bean burrito
title: How Many Calories in a Taco Bell Bean Burrito?
meta_description: Discover how many calories are in a taco bell bean burrito, including full nutrition breakdown, macros, sodium details, and simple tweaks for customization.
h1: How Many Calories in a Taco Bell Bean Burrito?
assumptions: Standard Taco Bell bean burrito with refried beans, cheese, red sauce, onions, and flour tortilla; based on official menu nutrition.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by location, preparation, customizations, and serving size. Check Taco Bell app or website for latest info.

quick_answer.text: A Taco Bell bean burrito contains about 350 calories and 13 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories are in a Taco Bell bean burrito?
faqs.a: Approximately 350 calories per standard bean burrito.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a Taco Bell bean burrito?
faqs.a: About 13 g of protein from beans and cheese.

faqs.q: How much sodium is in a Taco Bell bean burrito?
faqs.a: Around 1060 mg, mostly from beans and seasoning.

faqs.q: Are Taco Bell bean burritos vegetarian?
faqs.a: Yes, the standard version is vegetarian with refried beans and no meat.

faqs.q: How do customizations affect calories in a Taco Bell bean burrito?
faqs.a: Adding cheese or sour cream increases calories by 50-60 each; removing cheese lowers by about 100.
